Html:
I get the following message, any clue?

Unable to read the project file 'Dsl.csproj'.

C:\Sources\csd-671\Main\Source\Dsl\Dsl.csproj(43,11): The imported project "C:\Program Files\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\DSLTools\v2.1\Microsoft.DSLTools.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk.

Shame on me. I was on a VM without VS 2008 SDK installed.

francois_tanguay wrote:
I get the following message, any clue?

Unable to read the project file 'Dsl.csproj'.

C:\Sources\csd-671\Main\Source\Dsl\Dsl.csproj(43,11): The imported project "C:\Program Files\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\DSLTools\v2.1\Microsoft.DSLTools.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk.

Ok yes, that might help :-)

Just to make sure, you should be able to use the Configuration Section Designer without having the SDK installed, but to make changes you should of course install the SDK as well...

Main-VS2010

- 

Debugging project gives me a Warning as Error: "Missing XML comment for publicly visible type or member 'Sample.CustomTypeTypeConverter'.

Setting warning level to 2 solved it.
